metadata.title: CVE-2021-23995 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: When Responsive Design Mode was enabled, it used references to objects that were previously freed. We presume that with enough effort this could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.04.1').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.04.2').
